sen.j: 五代目 中村富十郎（ごだいめ なかむら とみじゅうろう、1929年（昭和4年）6月4日 -）は、歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: Tomijuro NAKAMURA V (June 4, 1929 -) is a kabuki actor.
Tomijuro NAKAMURA V (June 4, 1929 -) is a kabuki actor.
Tomijuro NAKAMURA V (June 4, 1929 -) is a kabuki actor.

sen.j: 屋号は天王寺屋 (歌舞伎)。
sen.e: His yago (trade name) is Tennojiya (kabuki).
His yago (trade name) is Tennojiya (kabuki).
His yago (trade name) is Tennojiya (kabuki).

sen.j: 定紋は鷹の羽八ツ羽矢車。
sen.e: Jomon (family crest) is eight hawk's feather shaped in a wheel shape.
sen.cmt: ファイルでは、当初「定紋は。」となっておりましたが、ウェブを確認致しましたところ、「鷹の羽八ツ羽矢車」と続くことがわかりましたので、追記致しました。
sen.e: Jomon (family crest) is eight hawk's feather shaped in a wheel shape.
Jomon (family crest) is eight hawk's feather shaped in a wheel shape.

sen.j: 本名は渡 邉一（わたなべ はじめ）。
sen.e: His real name is Hajime WATANABE.
His real name is Hajime WATANABE.
His real name is Hajime WATANABE.

sen.j: 重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）。
sen.e: He is designated as an Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
He is designated as an Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
He is designated as an Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 父は中村富十郎 (4代目)、母は日本舞踊家元の吾妻徳穂。
sen.e: His father is Tomijuro NAKAMURA IV, and his mother is Tokuho AZUMA from a head family of a school for Japanese dancing.
His father is Tomijuro NAKAMURA IV, and his mother is Tokuho AZUMA from a head family of a school for Japanese dancing.
His father is Tomijuro NAKAMURA IV, and his mother is Tokuho AZUMA from a head family of a school for Japanese dancing.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）8月、大阪中座「鏡獅子」の胡蝶で四代目坂東鶴之助を名乗り初舞台。
sen.e: He made his first appearance on stage in August 1943 by the name, Tsurunosuke BANDO IV, performing as Kocho of "Kagamijishi" (The Lion Dance) at Osaka Nakaza theater.
He made his first appearance on stage in August 1943 by the name, Tsurunosuke BANDO IV, performing as Kocho of "Kagamijishi" (The Lion Dance) at Osaka Nakaza theater.
He made his first appearance on stage in August 1943 by the name, Tsurunosuke BANDO IV, performing as Kocho of "Kagamijishi" (The Lion Dance) at Osaka Nakaza theater.

sen.j: 1964年（昭和39年）4月、歌舞伎座『頼朝の死』の畠山重保ほかで六代目市村竹之丞を襲名。
sen.e: In April 1964, he succeeded to the name, Takenojo ICHIMURA VI, performing as Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA and others of "Yoritomo no shi" (The Death of Yoritomo) at Kabukiza theater.
In April 1964, he succeeded to the name, Takenojo ICHIMURA VI, performing as Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA and others of "Yoritomo no shi" (The Death of Yoritomo) at Kabukiza theater.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）9月、歌舞伎座『逆櫓』の樋口と『娘道成寺』で五代目中村富十郎を襲名。
sen.e: In September 1972, he succeeded to the name, Tomijuro NAKAMURA V, performing as Higuchi in "Sakaro" and "Musume Dojoji" (The Maiden at Dojo-ji temple) at Kabukiza theater.
In September 1972, he succeeded to the name, Tomijuro NAKAMURA V, performing as Higuchi in "Sakaro" and "Musume Dojoji" (The Maiden at Dojo-ji temple) at Kabukiza theater.

sen.j: 逸話
sen.e: Anecdote
Anecdote
Anecdote

sen.j: 六代目竹之丞襲名の際、竹之丞の名跡は市村羽左衛門の幼名とされ、市村羽左衛門家にとっては由緒ある名跡である。
sen.e: When he was to succeed to the name of Takenojo VI, Takenojo's professional name was considered to be the childhood name of Uzaemon ICHIMURA, and this family name was a noble one for the Uzaemon ICHIMURA family.

When he was to succeed to the name of Takenojo VI, Takenojo's professional name was considered to be the childhood name of Uzaemon ICHIMURA, and this family name was a noble one for the Uzaemon ICHIMURA family.

When he was to succeed to the name of Takenojo VI, Takenojo's professional name was considered to be the childhood name of Uzaemon ICHIMURA, and this family name was a noble one for the Uzaemon ICHIMURA family.

sen.j: この襲名には、師である武智鉄二の意向が強く働いていたと言われるが、襲名披露の口上の席で座頭である市村羽左衛門 (17代目)より「本来ならば、竹之丞の名跡を継ぐべき人ではない」との強烈な批判ともとれる発言をされるなど、橘屋宗家との確執が浮き彫りになった。
sen.e: It was said that wishes of Tetsuji TAKECHI, his master, had strong influence on this succession, but during kojo (a ceremony to announce that an actor takes a new stage name), he received a remark 'He is essentially, not the person who should succeed to the family name of Takenojo', from the blind Uzaemon ICHIZAWA XVII, which may be taken as a severe criticism, and the discord between Tachibana head family was clearly brought to light.

It was said that wishes of Tetsuji TAKECHI, his master, had strong influence on this succession, but during kojo (a ceremony to announce that an actor takes a new stage name), he received a remark 'He is essentially, not the person who should succeed to the family name of Takenojo', from the leader of troupe Uzaemon ICHIZAWA XVII, which may be taken as a severe criticism, and the discord with Tachibana head family was clearly brought to light.
sen.cmt: the blind → the leader of troupebetween → with
sen.e: It was said that wishes of Tetsuji TAKECHI, his master, had strong influence on this succession, but during kojo (a ceremony to announce that an actor takes a new stage name), he received a remark 'He is essentially, not the person who should succeed to the family name of Takenojo', from the leader of troupe Uzaemon ICHIZAWA XVII, which may be taken as a severe criticism, and the discord with Tachibana head family was clearly brought to light.

sen.j: 1996年に、33歳年下の元女優（33歳）と結婚した。
sen.e: In 1996, he married a former actress who was 33 years younger then him.
In 1996, he married a former actress who was 33 years younger then him.
In 1996, he married a former actress who was 33 years younger then him.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）に長男・大が、2003年（平成15年）年には長女・愛子が生れ、特に後者は富十郎74歳の子供であるところから大きな話題にもなった。
sen.e: His first son Dai was born in 1999, and his first daughter Aiko was born in 2003, and since the latter was four when Tomijuro was at the age of 74, it became a great subject of conversation.
sen.cmt: 大の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His first son Dai was born in 1999, and his first daughter Aiko was born in 2003, and since the latter was born when Tomijuro was at the age of 74, it became a great subject of conversation.
His first son Dai was born in 1999, and his first daughter Aiko was born in 2003, and since the latter was born when Tomijuro was at the age of 74, it became a great subject of conversation.

sen.j: 長男の大は2001年（平成13年）に中村大を名乗り初舞台を踏み、2005年（平成17年）11月に初代中村鷹之資（なかむら たかのすけ）を襲名した。
sen.e: In 2001, his first son Dai made his first appearance on the stage by taking the name Dai NAKAMURA, and in November of 2005, he succeeded to the name, Takanosuke NAKAMURA I.
sen.cmt: 大の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: In 2001, his first son Dai made his first appearance on the stage by taking the name Dai NAKAMURA, and in November of 2005, he succeeded to the name, Takanosuke NAKAMURA I.
In 2001, his first son Dai made his first appearance on the stage by taking the name Dai NAKAMURA, and in November of 2005, he succeeded to the name, Takanosuke NAKAMURA I.

sen.j: 「豆天王寺屋」と呼ばれている鷹之資には20歳になった時に、富十郎の名跡を襲名させることを公言しているが、その襲名披露狂言には『娘道成寺』で競演するのが近頃の富十郎の目標であると言われている。
sen.e: Tomijuro declared publicly that he would make Takanosuke, who is referred to as "Mame tennojiya" to succeed the family name when he turned 20 years-old, and Tomijuro's latest goal is to vie with Takanosuke in "Musume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojoji Temple) at the Kyogen where he will make an announcement of his succession.

Tomijuro declared publicly that he would make Takanosuke, who is referred to as "Mame tennojiya" to succeed the family name when he turned 20 years-old, and Tomijuro's latest goal is to vie with Takanosuke in "Musume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojoji Temple) at the Kyogen where he will make an announcement of his succession.

Tomijuro declared publicly that he would make Takanosuke, who is referred to as "Mame tennojiya" to succeed the family name when he turned 20 years-old, and Tomijuro's latest goal is to vie with Takanosuke in "Musume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojoji Temple) at the Kyogen where he will make an announcement of his succession.

sen.j: 楽屋内・ファンからは、この親子での『連獅子』を早く見たいとの要望も多く寄せられているという。
sen.e: It is said that there are many requests coming from his fans in the back stage that they would like to see the father and son in "Renjishi" (A string of Lions) soon.
It is said that there are many requests coming from his fans in the back stage that they would like to see the father and son in "Renjishi" (A string of Lions) soon.
It is said that there are many requests coming from his fans in the back stage that they would like to see the father and son in "Renjishi" (A string of Lions) soon.

sen.j: 芸風
sen.e: Artistic style
Artistic style
Artistic style

sen.j: 当代随一の立方、踊りの名手として知られる。
sen.e: He is known to be the greatest tachikata (actors playing male roles) of the day, and a master of dancing.
sen.cmt: 立方の訳については、『日本の古典芸能』（中村雅之/淡交社）を参考に致しました。
sen.e: He is known to be the greatest tachikata (actors playing male roles) of the day, and a master of dancing.
He is known to be the greatest tachikata (actors playing male roles) of the day, and a master of dancing.

sen.j: 若年時上方を中心に活躍した際には、坂田藤十郎 (4代目)とともに、その美貌から「扇鶴コンビ」と呼ばれ人気を博した。
sen.e: When he was performing actively mainly in Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka) at a younger age, he was called 'Senkaku duo' along with Tojuro SAKATA for their beauty, and won immense popularity.
When he was performing actively mainly in Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka) at a younger age, he was called 'Senkaku duo' along with Tojuro SAKATA for their beauty, and won immense popularity.
When he was performing actively mainly in Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka) at a younger age, he was called 'Senkaku duo' along with Tojuro SAKATA for their beauty, and won immense popularity.

sen.j: この時期には武智歌舞伎にも参加し、ここで積極的に実験的な手法に触れ、古典の品格や解釈を学んだことは大きい。
sen.e: During this time, he also participated in Takechi Kabuki, and it is crucial that he came in touch with and actively experienced its experimental techniques and learned of the dignity and interpretations of the classics.

During this time, he also participated in Takechi Kabuki, and it is crucial that he came in touch with and actively experienced its experimental techniques and learned of the dignity and interpretations of the classics.

During this time, he also participated in Takechi Kabuki, and it is crucial that he came in touch with and actively experienced its experimental techniques and learned of the dignity and interpretations of the classics.

sen.j: 加えて、終戦後母とともにアヅマ・カブキとして日本舞踊の欧米公演を行ったことは、富十郎自身が語るように、その芸に有形無形の影響を与えている。
sen.e: In addition, the fact that he performed Azuma Kabuki as Japanese dance at the Europe and America performance with his mother after the war, gave both moral and material effect on to his art as Tomijuro himself described.

In addition, the fact that he performed Azuma Kabuki as Japanese dance at performance in Europe and America with his mother after the war, gave both moral and material effect on to his art as Tomijuro himself described.

In addition, the fact that he performed Azuma Kabuki as Japanese dance at performance in Europe and America with his mother after the war, gave both moral and material effect on his art as Tomijuro himself described.
sen.cmt: effect on to his art→effect on his art

sen.j: 一方で東京に出てからは、十五代目羽左衛門系の颯爽とした芸系とともに、尾上松緑 (2代目)に師事して尾上菊五郎 (6代目)の写実的な世話物の系統、また松緑が得意とした荒事や舞踏にいたるまで広く学んだ。
sen.e: On the other hand, after he went to Tokyo, along with the smart artistic style of Uzaemon XV, he became Shoroku ONOE II's pupil and learned extensively of the art of Kikugoro ONOE's sewamono (the realistic genre of a play that deals with life and current events of the common people) as well as aragoto (kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) and the dancing which was Shoroku's forte.
sen.cmt: 「舞踏」は「舞踊」(Japanese Dancing)とも考えましたが、原文に沿うよう訳出致しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, after he went to Tokyo, along with the smart artistic style of Uzaemon XV, he became Shoroku ONOE II's pupil and learned extensively of the art of Kikugoro ONOE's sewamono (the realistic genre of a play that deals with life and current events of the common people) as well as aragoto (kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) and the dancing which was Shoroku's forte.

On the other hand, after he went to Tokyo, along with the smart artistic style of Uzaemon XV, he became Shoroku ONOE II's pupil and learned extensively of the art of Kikugoro ONOE's sewamono (the realistic genre of a play that deals with life and current events of the common people) as well as aragoto (kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) and the dancing which was Shoroku's forte.

sen.j: 平成に入ってからは中村雀右衛門 (4代目)との名コンビを謳われて「二人椀久」などの傑作を残している。
sen.e: In the Heisei era, he was praised for making a great pair with Jakuemon NAKAMURA IV, and left behind a masterpiece such as 'Ninin Wankyu' (Love Story of Wankyu and Matsuyama).
In the Heisei era, he was praised for making a great pair with Jakuemon NAKAMURA IV, and left behind a masterpiece such as 'Ninin Wankyu' (Love Story of Wankyu and Matsuyama).
In the Heisei era, he was praised for making a great pair with Jakuemon NAKAMURA IV, and left behind a masterpiece such as 'Ninin Wankyu' (Love Story of Wankyu and Matsuyama).

sen.j: 当り役は数多いが、特に初代が初演した『京鹿子娘道成寺』にはお家芸としての思い入れがあるらしく、五代目襲名の興行にも出している。
sen.e: He had many successful roles, but he especially had intense feelings towards 'Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The Maiden at Dojoji Temple) as his family's specialty that Tomijuro I performed for the first time, and he put it out on performance when he succeeded to the name of Tomijuro V.

He had many successful roles, but he especially had intense feelings towards 'Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The Maiden at Dojoji Temple) as his family's specialty that Tomijuro I performed for the first time, and he put it out on performance when he succeeded to the name of Tomijuro V.

He had many successful roles, but he especially had intense feelings towards 'Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The Maiden at Dojoji Temple) as his family's specialty that Tomijuro I performed for the first time, and he put it out on performance when he succeeded to the name of Tomijuro V.

sen.j: その芸のよさについては、ほとんど当代の役者を褒めなかった池波正太郎が絶賛していたことでも一端をうかがいえよう。
sen.e: One is able to get some idea of how excellent his performance was, from the tremendous acclaim by Shotaro IKENAMI who seldom praised the actors of the day.
